content.title: Around the world, social media has become an inextricable aspect of people's lives. Furthermore, it has become an important aspect of how brands connect with their target audiences. Social media networks such as Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter are gaining new users every day. The majority of these people will continue to be users who share content on occasion, but a minority will choose to become content creators or 'influencers'.

Influencers are persons who have enough power to influence a substantial number of potential shoppers, subscribers, viewers, and so on. Typically, these influencers use social media networks to review and endorse items or services. If we think about it, we'll come across an influencer's content in just a few minutes of browsing through your page or over time. Think about it: they're all over the place! That witty comedian whose Instagram reels are pure gold? They're almost certainly a power player. For this Sunday's lunch inspiration, remember that beautifully filmed, bite-sized recipe video you saved on Instagram? Most likely, it was also shot by an influencer.

According to the recent study, collaborating with influencers helped to increase brand awareness & engagement as agreed by 65% of Indian Marketers & strategists. Hence, there's no better time to start if you want to be an Instagram influencer than right now!

Before we go into how to become an Instagram influencer in India, it's essential to note that this isn't a "become famous overnight" or "get right quick" project. To be regarded as a "serious" influencer, you must invest a significant amount of time and effort. Having a strategy to guide you on your path to being an influencer, on the other hand, will go a long way.
Create an Instagram Business Account to Get Started

An Instagram business account, unlike a personal Instagram account, allows you access to a variety of features that can help you expand your following. Because a successful influencer is defined by the number of people who follow them, it's safe to assume that without a business account, you'll be limited in terms of how much you can expand and how many people's feeds you can reach. A business account grants you access to Instagram's developed analytics tool, which provides us with comprehensive data and information on our followers. Instagram Insights lets users monitor key performance indicators in one place, from when the followers are most active to where they are from.
Choose a niche

It's critical to correctly characterise yourself after upgrading to an Instagram Business account so that the right audience can find you. It's impossible to know everything or be recognised for a wide range of skills. It's advisable to start with one (or max two) fields or areas of interest that you excel at. Is fashion something you're interested in? Do you enjoy preparing low-cost meals? Are you a seasoned gourmet food critic? Whatever it is, even if it is a very saturated interest area, there is always room to bring your distinctive touch to your favoured niche.
Create your Brand’s Voice & Personality

One of the most important aspects of learning how to become an Instagram influencer is to have a unique personal brand voice and personality. In a sea of established and aspiring influencers, your brand's personality becomes a vital differentiator. You can be confident that your communication will reach the correct individuals if you have a clear self-image of who you are and what you represent as an influencer. It's crucial to note, however, that this isn't a technique to limit your creative freedom; rather, it's a strategy to ensure that your efforts are focused on generating the most recognition, cohesion, and consistency for your personal brand. When all of these factors are taken into account, the result is a successful influencer growth story.
Create Content that is Curated
Create Content that is Curated

Although Instagram is primarily a visual platform, content is just as vital for aspiring influencers. You should curate content that has the capacity to connect with people in a meaningful way based on your brand tone, your audience's preferences, and your personal brand aesthetic. This means that, while you can talk about themes like fitness, travel, food, fashion, and lifestyle, you should go above and above to include unique insights, trends, ideas, and POVs in your content. Also, remember to utilise the appropriate hashtags to help your content reach the intended audience.
Use Trends to Your Advantage

As a burgeoning Instagram influencer, make sure you take advantage of current marketing trends that continue to create waves on social media. It's always a good idea to attempt and put your own touch on emerging trends, whether it's the different varieties of dalgona coffee that sprung up during lockdown or the make-up brush challenge. As a result, you become a participant in a broader conversation. If you have content related to their interests, users and audiences that want to be a part of that conversation are more likely to find you and engage with you.
This blog is just a thought-starter for rising instagram influencers, there is much more that content creators can do to be a successful influencer.

Digital marketing gained centre stage after corporations and marketers cut their marketing budgets for traditional means in 2020. Last year, social media became a dominant channel for brand discovery and buying decisions in the digital marketing hemisphere. As marketers sought economical and niche ways to reach out to GenZ and Millennials, influencer marketing gained traction. Marketers also realised that the influencer marketing approach is well-suited for a time when the audience is looking for motivation to keep going, whether it's through DIY videos as they become home chefs, learning new recipes, or focusing on self-care. Creators were crucial in fostering a sense of community, which many individuals craved while they were isolated.

Consumers shifted away from pictures and text in favour of watching more videos than ever before, aided by extended stay-at-home periods. India's online video user base has grown by 24% in the last three years to far more than 350 million individuals, as per Bain & Company. Indian smartphone users spend roughly 4.8 hours each day on their smartphones, with one hour spent on average watching movies, the survey studied.

As video consumption grows and attention spans shrink, influencer marketing provides a short turnaround time and a high level of personalization. Instead of having a list of influencers and estimated reach, brands are now seeking for agencies that can supply them with intriguing campaign ideas. They are more involved in their marketing initiatives and have begun to collaborate with influencers on creative ideas to create interesting content. As a result, in 2021, we saw brands shift from 'one-time connections' for single posts to long-term collaborations with influencers.

Instead of having a list of influencers and estimated reach, brands are now seeking for agencies that can supply them with intriguing campaign ideas. They are more involved in their marketing initiatives and have begun to collaborate with influencers on creative ideas to create interesting content. As a result, in 2021, we saw brands shift from 'one-time connections' for single posts to long-term collaborations with influencers.As scholars and business persons have seen growth in influencer marketing across multiple platforms, here’s what the recent studies predict:
The Battle for Creator-Friendly Tools Is Heating Up

Engagement is how social media platforms make money. Keeping influencers motivated to develop and distribute intriguing material is in their best interests. As a result, a number of major platforms are investing in resources that promote collaboration. Instagram introduced Collabs last year, which allows creators to collaborate on work and then share it with a bigger audience, as well as "Add Yours" stickers to promote Story interaction. Instagram's link stickers also give nano- and micro-influencers new ways to drive direct traffic to brand landing pages, allowing them to better quantify the value they bring to brands. Marketers have a great opportunity to use this entire suite of new features and develop more creative influencer partnerships to help them reach more followers, get more engagement and connect with new audiences.
Influencers will Torn Over the Marketing Funnel

The outbreak demonstrated the value of having a digital presence and having e-commerce skills. More consumers will likely embrace shopping straight from social networks in 2022, resulting in a continued shift toward social commerce. Influencers are becoming the complete marketing funnel, thanks to platforms' push for in-app shopping. Brands will be able to use them as a marketing tool as well as a buying motivator. As an expectation, the new social commerce features will boost the quantity of sponsored posts for shoppable products and provide new opportunities for brand sponsorship.
Influencers on Linkedin will Flourish

According to a recent study, an increasing percentage of organisations were using their own staff as social media influencers and content creators in 2020. LinkedIn has noticed the emergence of a new group of influencers – more executives, CEOs, and business owners — and is developing tools to support them. Last year, LinkedIn introduced "Creator mode," a new feature aimed squarely at professionals looking to break into the influencer sphere. This mode enables corporate leaders to exploit their skills while also focusing on community building on the platform. Brands should see this as a chance to tap into the reach and knowledge of LinkedIn's industry influencers and build cross-promotional relationships that take advantage of the platform's larger push to incentivise content development.
Influencers in Gaming will Become More Mainstream

The worldwide esports sector was worth more than $1.08 billion in 2021, and by 2024, it is predicted to be worth about $1.7 billion. Because of the high degree of audience involvement and interaction, we believe esports is a perfect fit for influencer marketing. Esports fans are devoted, and they might play for hours at a time.
What Does the Potential Offer for Influencer Marketing?

Brand-influencer partnerships will be stronger, more diverse, and more meaningful than ever in 2022, according to our predictions. Retail is continuing to move online as a result of the digital transformation, which means businesses will require more creative online collaborations to stand out in an all-digital environment.

title: How to go Viral on Instagram?

content.title: Going viral on Instagram means creating content that swiftly travels over the site and is shared by thousands of people. While that is relatively simple to comprehend, understanding how to "go viral" is a more challenging idea to grasp. There are no established standards or parameters for determining when content becomes viral.

There are a variety of aspects to consider, including: The number of shares a piece of content receives; the number of likes it receives; the number of new viewers it hits; the speed with which the content is digested; the number of link clicks a post obtains... as well as the content's total lifespan.
As you can see, determining whether or not your Instagram post has gone viral is difficult. When we see something on our social feeds, we usually know it's gone viral. As a sense, it's all relative.
General Idea of Hits you Need to go Viral!!!

Even if your account just has a few hundred or thousand followers, you'll need at least 100,000 likes and views, as well as thousands of comments, to go viral on Instagram. However, reaching that target isn't easy. You'll need a lot of other things to go your way. The key to it, however, is how engaged your fans are with your stuff.
      Now, let’s discuss some tips & tricks to go viral on instagram-
Understand your Fans, Don’t forget to Like, Share, Comment & Engage with other Profiles

Getting to know your Instagram audience, just like any other content marketing technique, is critical to developing viral content. You must understand what makes your followers react, their interests, and the types of material with which they engage the most. With this knowledge, you'll be better equipped to develop content that is relevant to your target audience. On the other hand, While we're on the subject of engagement, you should make an effort to interact with your Instagram users. Because Instagram is a social media platform, the emphasis should be on being sociable. Participate by liking other people's posts. And don't forget to add intelligent comments on why you liked the article. However, don't make the mistake of posting half-hearted responses and remarks. Bot engagement is shown by one word and one emoji comments. And rather than encouraging users to discover more about your account, this can drive them away. So interact with your fans, but do so in a way that is both relevant and intelligent.
Create an Eye-Catching Aesthetic

Having a distinct look and theme for your content goes hand in hand with inventiveness. Images with a lot of impact can propel your content to the top of the page. And getting there means even more people are engaging with your content. An excellent Instagram aesthetic has a theme that runs through all of the posts. This can be accomplished by employing the same set of filters or a similar photo backdrop.
Take a look at what your competitors are Discussing (and Borrow Ideas)

Studying what other successful accounts do is one of the easiest methods to make your Instagram photos go viral. There's no rule that says you can't use other people's ideas in your own work. It's possible that what works for them will also work for you. However, you should avoid copying and pasting other people's work to avoid infringement of their intellectual property rights. Make a list of the elements that generate the most interest instead.
Host Instagram Contests That Go Viral
Running a contest or giveaway is another approach to take use of Instagram's viral potential. Running a contest is a fantastic method to obtain the extra engagement you need to go viral quickly.
Emphasise on Creating Videos over Publishing Photos

Because videos are so popular on social media, you might be tempted to utilise them a lot on Instagram. However, photo material on Instagram receives 36% higher interaction than video. To achieve the best results, you're probably better off sticking to photographs rather than video if you want to generate very viral material.
Collaborate with Industry Influencers
Various brands not only create awareness but also anchor themselves in their area of influence by enlisting celebrities and influencers to use their products.
Paid Ads- An aid to Boost your Reach

According to social media marketing data, Instagram has over 2 million advertisers. That's because many businesses recognise that Instagram users are more likely to engage with sponsored material there than on any other social media network. As a result, if you want to create viral Instagram content, you should think about paying to promote your posts and expand your reach. This isn't limited to the more well-known brands. This is something that Instagram accounts of all sizes do to increase their chances of going viral.
It's now up to you to bring it all together and build your own viral content, a successful recipe.

Mistakes are part of life. Mistakes are bound to occur. Regrettably, Instagram mistakes happen publically. With over 1 billion active Instagram users, it's becoming more difficult to expand your online company without a presence on Instagram. Over 70% of American firms have already joined Instagram. With so many users, it's easy to see how some basic Instagram blunders may be costly and even assist your competitors.

Never fear! Because your ultimate goal should be that you learn from any common mistakes you make and that you improve in the future. In this blog, we will now discuss some blunders that marketers must avoid in order to expand.
Like & Followers Purchase

Anyone & everyone can buy likes & followers very easily, say from a shopping spree. However, The main issue is that when you purchase likes and followers, you're paying for quantity rather than quality. Undoubtedly, your stats may appear fantastic, but what good are they if your audience is made up entirely of robots who say nothing useful? (Please don't come for me in the middle of the night, robots.) Paying for automatic outgoing remarks is the same thing. What's the purpose of having a social media presence if you can't communicate with your followers?
Use of Poor Quality Visuals

Instagram is primarily a visual platform. So, if you're going to share something, make it beautiful—or at the very least fascinating! Shoot using natural light or on neutral backdrops if you don't have access to professional photography talents or a high-end camera. You're better off not publishing a photo than posting a lousy one. But, with so many fantastic photo editing and graphic design tools available, there's no reason to publish something shoddy.
Excessive or Insufficient Posting

Choosing the appropriate frequency of Instagram posts—or any other social media platform, for that matter—is a tricky balance: a socially squishy, if you will. If you make too few postings, you risk seeming out of touch or forgotten. If you make too many postings, you may come out as desperate or obnoxious.So, how much should you post on Instagram? Multiple times a day might be fine for a news station, while a few times a week could be more appropriate for a cosmetics business. To figure out when your followers are online, pay attention to statistics, and experiment with your posting schedule, keep an eye on when they are online. Make use of the instagram insight feature for this purpose. To fully explore your possibilities, you can even automate your schedule using the Hootsuite dashboard. Who knows, maybe your audience enjoys some late-night activity.
Neglecting Metrics

Speaking of metrics or analytics, another common blunder made by marketers on Instagram is ignoring the data. You should be watching the metrics, that matter, meticulously so that you can see patterns and growth. How can you replicate your results if you're aiming to increase your engagement rate but aren't tracking your stats?
Excessive Use of Hashtags

Hashtags are a fantastic method for people to locate your content on Instagram. They're also a wonderful technique to make your material appear to be spam. Although you may use up to 30 hashtags per post, the most typical amount of hashtags seen on Instagram is between one and three. To figure out what works best for you, you'll have to experiment.
Publishing Monotonous Content

Posting uninteresting or misleading content is the most serious Instagram infraction, according to the public court. Give users something to interact with if you want them to engage with your brand. Avoid posting just for the sake of posting. Make posts something they'll be interested in—something fascinating, instructive, or entertaining.
Organizing Off-Target Contests

On Instagram, there are a slew of "follow us and claim your reward" contests. But, in the long haul, are they actually effective? Contests with easy entry requirements can draw thousands of individuals in a matter of days, but most of them will depart once the winner is announced. Furthermore, such contests have the unintended consequence of mistargeting your audience. The great majority of people join them only for the purpose of trying their luck. They are merely looking for freebies and are not interested in your product.
Branding That Isn't Consistent

Your Instagram profile is only a small element of a larger marketing ecosystem. You most likely have a website, other social media profiles, and maybe even a physical storefront. To ensure that your brand is powerful and obvious, all of these pieces should be connected by an uniform string. Every profile should have your logo. The visual design and editorial tone of each element should be consistent.
Ignoring Spell Check

On the internet, typos are unavoidable. Even professional writers are not immune to making blunders. A little spelling or grammatical eror error, on the other hand, might make an otherwise well-crafted piece appear sloppy. So include a short proofread into your social media posting routine, and have a second pair of eyes go over your postings before they go live.
Publishing Inconvenient Links

Because Instagram doesn't allow you to connect URLs in comments, submitting a long, cumbersome link merely looks sloppy—and like you have no idea what you're doing. Plus, let's face it: no one will enter it into their browser. Links can be included in Instagram Stories by brands with 10,000 followers. Those without that privilege frequently employ the "link in bio" technique.

Remember, don't be too hard on yourself if you've made any (or all) of the above Instagram blunders. The beauty of a digital platform is that it's never too late to make a course correction. Turn your Insta-mistakes into, um, Insta-tunities, and boost your company's social media profile.

title: How to Make Money on Instagram?

content.title: Many brands' social media existence have been mainly focused on Instagram, which drives profitable traffic to landing pages, increases, and builds an engaged community.
Consider sharing more than just your photographs and videos if you're seeking methods to generate money on Instagram. Let your viewers know who you are.

Dedicated groups on the social networking app, even if they number in the thousands, attract businesses. You might be able to generate money if your followers meet the profile of customers that a business is attempting to target. And...You don't want to take the influencer route? Then probably you should consider selling your own items.
Now, the very first question in your mind would be regarding the amount of money the influencers make from Instagram.. Am I right??

So here is what recent research studied! According to Search Engine Journal, Cristiano Ronaldo, Ariana Grande, Dwayne Johnson, Kylie Jenner, and Selena Gomez are the top five Instagram influencers as of April 2021, each with over 200 million followers. While these Instagram celebrities might make astronomical sums of money, non-celebrities can also make a decent living. According to the search marketing company, influencers with a million followers may earn roughly $670 every article. On Instagram, a content producer with 100,000 followers may earn over $200 every post, while those with 10,000 followers can earn around $88.
Hence, the simple & basic formula is, more the number of followers & posts, more the amount of money earned.
Now, the next question probably would be how many followers one needs to generate money..?! And.. Am I right..? Again?

An article read that just around 1000 or so followers can allow you to earn money. A widely known digital marketing expert, Neil Patel said that the key to success is engagement, which is defined as followers that like, share, and comment on your content. Brands are likely to invest in you because of the profitable activities you'll generate through your account, even if you have an enthusiastic fan audience, no matter how little.
Ways to Generate Money on Instagram
Gain Sponsorship – The Primary Way

The most common way for Instagram users to make money is through publishing sponsored posts or stories. So, how do you go about finding a sponsor? Potential partners may approach you in various instances. If you don't really want to be queued for a brand to approach you, look into businesses that can assist you in finding and collaborating with brands. And, no doubt, it is up to you to decide which company to choose based on your requirements. When looking for a partnership or choosing between different offers, look for things that you and people you influence would actually embrace. Be authentic.
Business Endorsement

There are other ways to generate money using Instagram. To help your business expand, you may also work on creating your own business account. Create things you're attempting to sell or initiatives you're supporting findable by taking well-lit images of them. As discussed in earlier blogs, make your own hashtags and see what hashtags your rivals are using. Encourage your customers to upload images of their purchases on social media and tag you in them for promotions. You can also discover more about your audience by using Instagram's insights function; you may view how many people have seen your post, as well as demographic information such as age and gender.
Earn Badges

When you use Instagram's live function to broadcast real-time videos, you may earn money straight from your audience. Viewers may purchase badges, which are effectively tips, to demonstrate support as you display your abilities, products, so on and so forth. Badges may be purchased for $0.99, $1.99, or $4.99. The heart symbols will start displaying next to the comment section from people who have purchased it. To increase participation — and perhaps badges — consider using the Q&A feature or giving shoutouts to comments while streaming.
Advertisements - Aid to Commercialize your Broadcasts

Allowing sponsors to show adverts throughout your videos is another way to make money. To get started, just go to your creator account settings, activate the monetization option for in-stream video ads, and then, as usual, publish videos. Make sure to keep your videos at least 2 minutes long as Instagram recommends keeping videos between 2 and 4 minutes long.

title: How to get Sponsorship from Brands?

content.title: Instagram has grown in popularity as a platform for marketers to market their goods. Because of its popularity, you might believe that Instagram is already too crowded for you to be noticed. But here's the thing: businesses are waking up to the potential of ordinary people to promote their products. The most engagement comes from micro-influencers as compared to the big players.

It's natural that you want to work as a paid Instagram influencer; after all, the average cost of a sponsored Instagram post is $300, and if you're as successful as Yogi Rachel Brathen, you might earn $25,000 for every post. However, you may find the concept of having your postings sponsored, amusing! You're not photographing skydiving in Australia or paragliding in Colombia; you're photographing your brunch. You may, however, be more marketable than you believe!
Brand Creation & Definition

If you can identify your specialty, you'll get the most engagement. Do you want to post about travel and lifestyle, or concentrate on influencing through your dance moves? In any case, it's critical to establish your brand. Branding has a lot to do with your overall aesthetic, keeping aside the type of content you post. What style do you want to use for your posts? What are you trying to convey? It is advisable to consider adopting a unified feed theme to help reinforce your brand. Precision is crucial. Additionally, creating a website with a similar design and message to your Instagram account is a smart method to integrate your Instagram with an online presence; the more you streamline your social media profiles, the simpler it will be for companies to see how you can assist them.
Have Knowledge about your Viewers

Knowing your viewers is essential for persuading a company to collaborate with you. It's also mutually beneficial for you: if you know your audience, you'll be able to accurately determine which businesses will benefit the most from your sponsorship. Begin by obtaining the basics: what is your key demographics’ gender, age, and geographic location? Which of your articles do they like the most? What can you deduce from the fact that they respond better to material at certain times of the day?
Be Consistent in Publishing Content

A recent study found out that one should post at least once each day, however, you can post up to three times per day.  The study also found the best time to post, i.e., 8:00am to 9:00am & 2:00am. It's vital to publish at least once a day to increase your following. Instagram's algorithm prefers new and fresh material, and you don't want your audience to abandon you or forget about you because you're not posting consistently, keeping in mind the quality of content. However, you'll have to explore to see what fits better for you and your target audience, using Instagram's insight feature.
Authentic Hashtags & Geotags

Start creating your unique hashtags & encourage your audience to use them. Do not forget to add geotags with your posts. Geotags are the tags which specify your location while publishing the post. If someone is looking for a certain location, geotags can help them discover you. This not only helps you earn more followers, but it also helps you appeal to brands looking to reach a specific audience.
Mention Brands in your Content

Now you are all set to reach out to various brands. You are done identifying your brand and target audience, as well as published some high-quality, original content. You should now have a clear understanding of the sorts of firms that might benefit from collaborating with you. It's essential to begin small. Instead of going straight for Van Heusen if you're interested in clothing, consider tagging tiny clothing start-ups you've already seen on Instagram. Initiate by tagging smaller brands in your descriptions. Respond to comments like "Where can I grab one?" or "For how much?" and the brand will quickly notice that you've shown yourself to be a strong sales partner.
Throw the ball for Paid Sponsorships
It's quite OK to approach brands and offer your services. You might be able to secure certain contracts without having to wait for businesses to reach out to you if you have the appropriate pitch.
Add Contact Info & Sense Self-Worth

Consider your bio an opportunity to express your desire to work with businesses as an influencer. Include an email address or a website where they may contact you. Additionally, when brands contact you, be sure you know how much you're going to charge. The industry benchmark for 1,000 followers is $10, however this might vary based on how many likes you get every post. You'll also be capable of charging more as your business grows.

Instagram is presently the world's largely used social media site, with over 1 billion monthly users. Instagram has evolved into a fantastic way to build your business, in addition to connecting with friends and posting photographs from our life. An interesting fact is that, instagram is now an excellent way to grow a following, whether you're an influencer, a brand manager, or a business owner. Individuals and brands are shifting their business decisions to social media, which now has around 3.5 billion active users.

Although everyone wants to expand their Instagram account quickly, it is a challenging feat. As per the recent study, 52.35% of Instagram followers have less than 1,000 followers, according to Mention. With 37.41% of Instagram users, the next largest sector is those with 1,000 to 10,000 followers. Only about 10% of Instagram profiles have more than 10K followers.
Interesting Statistics about Instagram

As per the study conducted, following are the conclusions that are drawn with regards to instagram-
      Instagram is the second most popular social media platform after Facebook.
      Instagram users spend an average of 53 minutes per day on the platform, compared to the time spent on Facebook, i.e. 58 minutes.
      Instagram is the platform where 83% users claim that they discover new products and services.
      Every day, around 500 million people use Instagram Stories.
      Every day, over 100 million Instagram photographs and videos are shared.
      Instagram video posts are ones which are more likely to be appreciated, recommended & engaged with.
Now, mentioned below are some tips and tricks, as per the study, on how to grow your Instagram faster-
Schedule Posts

When we say, grow your instagram, the main thing which is mainly referred to is increasing the followers count. To increase the followers count, focus on aesthetics of your feed, create content of high quality. However, simply writing and creating content isn't enough; you must also work on improving & growing your techniques. Consider using an Instagram scheduling tool to plan your posts ahead of time and lay down your Instagram strategy on auto-pilot.
      Scheduling your posts can help you in engaging more with the Instagram audience, thereby helping in increasing the followers count.
Prioritise Quality, Not Quantity

According to some sources, you should post on Instagram one to three times per day; nevertheless, this may not be the ideal strategy for you. While brand recognition is beneficial, hyper-frequent postings may be perceived as spam by your prospective followers, who may begin to abandon you. Second, if you start publishing multiple times per day and then slow down, your target audience's user engagement rates may drop. 
      If you can not provide your audience with high-quality images every day, upload less frequently. It's always advisable to share a few strong quality photos every week rather than a lot of poor-quality content. You may also use Instagram advertisements to promote your high-performing posts, with a call-to-action to visit your profile and then your website.
Instagram Stories-The Obvious Benefit

Instagram began as a photo-sharing social media platform, but it has already expanded well beyond that. Every day, 500 million new stories are created throughout the world. Despite the fact that stories only endure 24 hours, their influence lasts much longer, especially with the most popular stories, which you can place in your profile highlights and allow visitors to play over and over.
      Of course, stories can be in the form of a photo, but for better engagement, we recommend using videos. If you are unable to shoot or edit clips, make use of the tools accessible to you. As part of your Instagram marketing strategy, you should also plan on posting Instagram Reels, live videos, and IGTV videos.
Stand out with your own Hashtags

Hashtags aid in the formation of a community by bringing individuals together who share interests in common. The appropriate hashtag might help you reach a wide and targeted audience with your image, video, or Instagram story.
      Many firms are generating their own hashtags and urging customers to use them - #JustDoIt, #ImLovinIt – we all are aware of what they mean.
      I understand that persuading others to use your hashtag and start following you may be challenging, but how about starting with smaller groups?
Socialize & Comment on Other Profiles

Don't forget that Instagram is a social networking platform where you may meet new people and engage with others who have similar interests to you. Start like a bunch of photographs relevant to your profile theme, for example, if you're showing a healthy lifestyle or fractional nutrition, seek for others who are talking about it. Leave comments on other people's blogs, congratulate them, or express your own thoughts on the subject. And never forget to take a sneak peak in your personal inbox and comment section.
Create a Unique Grid

Visual communication has a lot of power. Don't underestimate it. Customers recognise a product first by its logo or colour choice when it comes to displaying a brand. If we see a soft drink with a red label on the bottle, we know it's the well-known Coca-Cola.
      Make your Instagram grid uniform and aesthetically appealing by following the same steps. An additional tip is to put some phrases on a single-color background or use the same object in every third or fourth photo in the row.
An Appealing Instagram Bio

Utilize your Instagram bio to its full potential because it will be many people's first engagement with your brand, you must ensure that it stands out from the competition. Your Instagram handle is not sufficient. You should be precise and succinct about what your business does on your business account, and include keywords that are related to your brand or business so that visitors understand exactly what you're all about.
      Another tip is to use a tool like LinkGallery, a new product from famous URL shortener, Rebrandly- to route your visitors to several locations from a specific node

This year, there are a variety of strategies to expand your Instagram presence. Consider the style and general appearance of your profile, and ensure that you publish often and that the stuff you offer is useful to your fans. Use Instagram hashtags and geotagging to expand your audience. Make it easy for others to locate you and see your key interests and themes that are relevant to your personal branding. On social media, collaborate with other influencers and brands. Other accounts can increase your visibility through shoutouts, promotions, and freebies.

title: How Big is the Influencer Marketing Industry?

content.title: “Over the last few years, brands have shown significant interest in influencer marketing. The pandemic has accelerated the adoption of influencer marketing by brands making it an integral part of the brand marketing strategy and is now an important part of our media mix recommendation to brands,” said Prasanth Kumar, CEO, GroupM South Asia.

The bond of trust and authenticity that influencers share with their audiences has piqued the interest of companies, allowing them to harness the same by partnering with an influencer. The INCA Influencer Marketing survey studied that influencer marketing was a high or top priority for 100% of marketing executives in 2021. The majority of respondents, i.e., around 50% plan to boost their influencer marketing budgets by 25-36%.

Many organisations are already accustomed to working with social media influencers, but the industry is always changing, and brands must adapt their strategy appropriately. As influencer types have expanded, the market is fast increasing, with influencers catering to every imaginable niche and sub-niche interest. Each of these sorts has its own set of advantages and disadvantages for brands. Brands are increasingly turning to micro- and nano-influencers, kidfluencers, gaming influencers, and virtual (computer-generated) influencers in addition to superstars with large followings like Kim Kardashian West and Kylie Jenner.
Influencer Marketing Spend

People are likely to be more engaged on social media, and at least that part of such time will be spent communicating with influencers. According to a GlobalWebIndex poll conducted in May 2020, 96% of US and UK customers who followed influencers engaged with them enough to quite the same amount as before the coronavirus pandemic.
Influencer Marketing Stats

Brands find it difficult to gain the same feeling of consistency as influencers, but courtesy to influencer marketing, that trust can be extended to your brand. As an advantage of influencer marketing, the brands now avoid wasting money on self-promotion, by having influencers speak on their behalf and communicate the message they want people to hear and believe. As per the research, around 70% of teens believe more in influencers instead of celebrities from the past.

These days, 78% of women use social media, with Snapchat and Instagram being the most popular. When it comes to influencer marketing, more than half of women have made purchases as a result of what they saw on social media. Being honest and motivating is the key to engage this niche through influencers.

Not only do 49% of people rely on influencer recommendations, but 40% have made a purchase after seeing something on Twitter, YouTube, or Instagram. Consumers are more inclined to make a purchase if they are confident about an influencer's advice. The influencers’ already built trust can also be used to benefit brands.

Because organic development for firms has grown increasingly difficult without advertising and amplification, the fashion and beauty sectors rely significantly on influencer marketing. In this industry, 57% of businesses presently employ influencers as part of their marketing mix, with another 21% planning to do so in the following year. Many firms are now leveraging influencers to tremendous success, such as Tropicana's @foreveryoursbetty, Tess Daly's Benefit offers, and Boohoo's hundreds of thousands of Instagram followers. While many fashion and beauty firms want to use influencers, they want to make sure that the ones they hire are socially conscious in order to be successful.

Over the last two years, influencer marketing, as an industry, has grown at a breakneck pace. The sector, which was worth $1.7 billion in 2016, is expected to expand to $13.8 billion by 2022 as it experiences stronger returns and becomes a more effective marketplace. Because of this expansion, marketers will need to modify influencer marketing tactics in terms of how campaigns are monitored, generate analytics to scale campaigns, and consider how to manage relationships between brands and influencers.

title: How Much ROI Brands Get with Influencer Marketing?

content.title: Influencer marketing, for the uninitiated, is a focused form of advertising in which you form relationships with influencers in order to reach their audiences. Influencer marketing can range from offering free products to content creators in the hopes that they will mention them to more structured engagements in which influencers are rewarded for post. Hybrid collaborations, in which influencers can also profit from affiliate tracking networks, are becoming increasingly prevalent.

Influencer Marketing is exploding in popularity, & it is just improving over time and becoming more quantifiable. Despite the increasing vogue of this marketing channel, only around 67% of the total brands who are using Influencer Marketing as one of their marketing channels, care to measure their ROIs.
Return On Investments (ROI)

Recently, I came across many articles that declare “Influencer Marketing delivers 11x ROI over all other forms of digital media”. Impressive, isn’t it?? Businesses make $6.50 in revenue, on average, for every $1 spent on influencer marketing, a 2019 survey by the Influencer MarketingHub studied. Typically a 5:1 ratio is the rule of thumb for ROI that marketing quantifies, with around 10:1 being an exceptional ROI.

Influencers put forward economical ways for creating exclusive contents.But as it is rightly said, with every opportunity coming our way, are the threats that accompany along. Understanding how to monitor the ROI of your influencer marketing strategy is more crucial than ever because of changing algorithms on social networks. Following are some ways of effectively calculating ROI of influencer marketing-
Goal Identification
What is your goal? To increase brand awareness? Or to increase sales? Or growing the number of viewers? The most common blunder made by brands is not realizing what they really want to achieve.
KPIs Determination

KPIs are the Key Performance Indicators. The KPIs you'll need to track to ensure your campaign's success will be determined by your goal. So, say, if your goal is lead generation, it makes the most sense to measure the number of new email subscribers.
Identifying Marketing Strategies & Platforms

Determining marketing strategies & platforms, that which will be more effective for your set goals, is an important thing to do next for measuring ROI. Influencer campaigns can take the shape of competitions or freebies, discounts or promo codes, or account takeovers, but they all need to be tailored to your objectives.
Expense Evaluation

This is where the “I’ in ROI enters in. How much investment are you planning to make in the influencer campaign?
      Your planned investments should include all costs starting from the smallest expense to any large expense.

Influencer Marketing involves promotion of products & services, giving income generation opportunities to influencers ranging from micro to mega. These days, it is one of the successful marketing channels which works majorly on the basis of word-of-mouth publicity. As per the recent statistics on influencer marketing, around 71% of the consumers make their purchases based on the social media references. Quite impressive it is, don’t you think?

Influencers such as bloggers, photographers, artists, musicians, writers, retailers, etc. are just normal people like us who just have the nerve & spirit of showcasing their talents on social media platforms like instagram, facebook, twitter, youtube, snapchat etc. Everyone of us who are born in this world have some or the other hidden talent. It is all about how well you are aware of it & its utilisation.. 
      Following are some briefly discussed points on why this marketing channel works so well.
Faith in Influencers

Faith is an essential pillar which leads to the success of any organisation or a campaign. The consumers’ faith in the influencers is what makes them purchase the product or services they deem to consume, after all, as it is rightly said, faith permeates our world.
Quality of Content

Be it you or me, we will only make a decision of purchase once we are satisfied with the quality of advertisement displayed for any product or services. Because it is not always possible to have a free trial for any or every product, so what we all believe in, is the quality of the content with which we are provided. When the brands and influencers showcase and advertise in their best capacities with proper use of skills & technology, the chances of purchase for that product by the audience, increases!
Engaging & Entertaining

If this content will not be engaging, I don’t think any of you will even give it a read. And if we talk about entertainment, then many people’s interest is built in the advertisement only if it entertains them. Creating engaging and entertaining content for influencer marketing is what gives this channel a great success!
Preciseness

Preciseness of anything, be it a blog or a video created for promotion, is always appreciated. One always cherishes the exactness & the accuracy of the products & services advertised. Because somewhere, our friends & families also play an important role in influencing us to buy certain services, only when they are themselves satisfied; so we can conclude that the exactness & accuracy, or in short, preciseness has an impact on influencing the viewers & the consumers to make the purchase decisions.
An Interesting Fact!

You know what??? The Ads Blocking system never affects this marketing channel. We can definitely prevent ads from continuously popping up, but can never prevent the influencer’s content from displaying on our screens. Interesting… isn’t it? And many people even don’t try to block such contents from the influencers as they find it engaging, entertaining & worth discussing. This is definitely a bonus for the success of Influencer marketing.

title: How Metaverse will Shape/Effect Influencer Marketing?

content.title: How about a fantasy world of candies and chocolates around you becoming a virtual reality around you? How about a fantasy world of spiderman & batman around you becoming a virtual reality around you? Or if you are not a sweet lover, what about some accessories or clothing or beauty or fitness products? Imagine, watching it on your screens and the very next moment it becomes a virtual reality? Isn’t it amazing???
Metaverse

Boys & girls and ladies & gentlemen, as fantasized above, this is what Metaverse is all about! To understand Metaverse, try replacing it with “cyberspace”; 90% of the time the meaning will not change substantially. And the reason is that the term refers to a broad shift in the way we interact using technology, not any specific technology. In more simple terms, Metaverse is the world created with the combination of Virtual Reality(VR) and Augmented Reality(AR) and can be entered using VR Goggles.
Influencer Marketing
As discussed in previous blogs, Influencer Marketing is a marketing channel that helps promote the products & services of various brands with the help of our influencers.

Influencer Marketing is all about promotion of brands through the means of social media, so Metaverse inclusive of Influencer Marketing will definitely be the cherry on top. As metaverse has the ability to change the life we live, undoubtedly, it will even change the outlook of social media. The sophisticated targeting market will be driven to next level; the brands will have to think to maintain their position in the market keep themselves updated with new trends in Metaverse, and moreover, the brainstorming of influencers will also begin, they will need to think about creating their own unique avatars to work with brands in metaverse.

How amazing the world will be, when Metaverse will be in complete existence around. I am feeling goosebumps while talking about this. This marketing channel with the existence of Metaverse will be completely at next levels.

Mark Zuckerberg said, “And my hope, if we do this well, I think over the next five years or so, in this next chapter of our company, I think we will effectively transition from people seeing us as primarily being a social media company to being a metaverse company”.

The Metaverse will provide creators with the whole new world of interaction & communication with the viewers, audience, or consumers. The influencer marketing provides the viewers with the quality content, engaging, entertaining & worth discussing content, builds faith, precise & accurate content and with no ads blocking system, because of which it is successful.

The creators put their heart & soul in creating things just to initiate the viewers to make a purchase decision & many are even successful; and once metaverse will be in action, the chances of people to buy the products & services will more likely increase. The influencer marketing is a young industry, and with metaverse in play, it has potential to become a multibillion dollar company in this virtual world.
